Yes, Wing On has taken several measures to ensure the safety of its customers and employees during the COVID-19 pandemic. The company has implemented guidelines and measures in accordance with government regulations, such as mandatory mask-wearing for employees and customers, social distancing rules, and enhanced disinfection and cleaning procedures.

Customers entering the stores are required to have their temperatures checked, and hand sanitizers are available throughout the stores. The company has also installed acrylic barriers at cashier counters to minimize contact between customers and employees.

To minimize the number of customers shopping in-store, Wing On has expanded its online shopping services and offers delivery services for groceries and other products. Additionally, Wing On has introduced a virtual queuing system, allowing customers to reserve a spot in line without having to wait in line physically.

Through these measures, Wing On has prioritized the safety and wellbeing of its customers and employees during this challenging time, while still providing the same quality products and services.
